example[0]: Buyers have been holding off until the price falls.
example[1]: Hold off making your decision until Monday.
definition[1]: to prevent someone who is trying to attack or defeat you from succeeding
example[2]: Not even a gun could hold him off forever.
definition[2]: to prevent someone from coming towards you or succeeding in speaking to you
example[3]: There’s already a crowd of reporters outside – I’ll try to hold them off for a while.
definition[3]: if rain or bad weather holds off, it does not start, although it looked as if it would
example[4]: The rain held off until after the game.
